8993.reason:
This mod author adds poorly balanced drawbacks to his mods, but the real problem is that he intentionally avoids documenting them, so users will get ass-raped when they don't play with his exact build. Basically a minefield.

Money quote: "I made a deliberate choice not to explain how it works, but it's really not that bad once you figure it out." This was in reference to a hidden damage trigger that kills you very quickly unless you happen to be running a high-INT build (there is no way to find this out before triggering the damage, and the readme does not even mention the existence of this trigger.)

10.reason: Horribly outdated. Use the Patch 7 version.

6473.reason:
This mod uses loose files. Normally, we suggest to NEVER mod your Data folder, but this one can be a rare exception. Especially since you may have different versions of the mod installed during multiplayer.

Just remember this is the only mod you should have installed as a loose file.

3479.reason:
You shouldn't ever install any of those party limit extender mods for BG3. For a few reasons:

1. You don't NEED a mod installed to set your party limit size. You can run the command yourself, once, and it'll work forever on that save.
ㅤ
2. If you have everyone in your party at once, then the game will randomly select 4 of your companions that get used in dialogue. It does not add ALL companions to the dialogue.
ㅤ
3. The game just will spazz out at some points and you will have to dismiss your companions

Check the "View Alternative" link for a guide on how to set up an uncapped party limit on your save through Script Extender console, then you'll never have to worry about it again.

327.reason:
If you are using this for the sake of playing a 5+ multiplayer campaign, this is the place to go. But you are in for a world of pain. Even the best and brightest of ModHQ couldn't stand all the debugging it took to get consistently working.

As for extending your party limit past 4, you shouldn't ever install any of those party limit extender mods for BG3. For a few reasons:

1. You don't NEED a mod installed to set your party limit size. You can run the command yourself, once, and it'll work forever on that save.
ㅤ
2. If you have everyone in your party at once, then the game will randomly select 4 of your companions that get used in dialogue. It does not add ALL companions to the dialogue.
ㅤ
3. The game just will spazz out at some points and you will have to dismiss your companions

Check the "View Alternative" link for a guide on how to set up an uncapped party limit on your save through Script Extender console, then you'll never have to worry about it again.

353.reason:
This mod exists because mod authors are too lazy to not override the entire "Races.lsx" file, so this is a sloppy, tranny-curated list of a bunch of mods put together into a Races.lsx. If Padme4000 doesn't personally sign off on the mod, then it isn't added to this.

Unfortunately, the mod is likely still necessary unless the CC mods you want have a ModHQ cleaned up version of them. Ping @loregamer on the forum to make a patch, if you want. He has a script to automate this.

12727.reason: This *looks* like a pretty comprehensive rules update from the sourcebook. Unfortunately the korean autist behind it has decided to also bundle in a shitty AI rework that breaks most magic encounters, turning them into counterspell/Sanctuary/CC spam that drag battles out forever. Of course, he autistically refuses to split the AI crap from the main mod.

Project Nevada is horrible. Avoid avoid avoid. Check Viva New Vegas for recommended alternatives.

Unlimited Companions re-compiles every script in the game and will break many mods. Use JIP Companions Command and Control if you want unlimited companions at the same time or other companion-related features like equipment managing, infinite ammo, combat-ready companions and much more.
Monster Mod has broken meshes that cause crashing and broken levelled lists.

CAUTION.reason: It's generally recommended that you don't play Fallout 3 in its original form and release, but rather use Tale of Two Wastelands. It is Fallout 3 ported to the New Vegas engine, and is a much better experience. You'll also get access to a lot of mods that are exclusive to the New Vegas.

BROKEN.reason: Modding methods are being patched, and the workarounds are becoming more and more esoteric. They'll likely start banning people who are STILL modding. Use an alt account.
